verses.verse: Why <WH4100> standest<WH5975> thou afar off,<WH7350> O LORD?<WH3068> why hidest<WH5956> thou thyself in times<WH6256> of trouble?<WH6869>
The wicked<WH7563> in his pride<WH1346> doth persecute<WH1814> the poor:<WH6041> let them be taken<WH8610> in the devices<WH4209> that<WH2098> they have imagined.<WH2803>
For <WH3588> the wicked<WH7563> boasteth<WH1984> of<WH5921> his heart's<WH5315> desire,<WH8378> and blesseth<WH1288> the covetous,<WH1214> whom the LORD<WH3068> abhorreth.<WH5006>
The wicked,<WH7563> through the pride<WH1363> of his countenance,<WH639> will not<WH1077> seek<WH1875> after God: God<WH430> is not<WH369> in all<WH3605> his thoughts.<WH4209>

His ways<WH1870> are always<WH3605> <WH6256> grievous;<WH2342> thy judgments<WH4941> are far above<WH4791> out of his sight:<WH4480> <WH5048> as for all<WH3605> his enemies,<WH6887> he puffeth<WH6315> at them.
He hath said<WH559> in his heart,<WH3820> I shall not<WH1077> be moved:<WH4131> for I shall never<WH1755> <WH1755> <WH834> <WH3808> be in adversity.<WH7451>
His mouth<WH6310> is full<WH4390> of cursing<WH423> and deceit<WH4820> and fraud:<WH8496> under<WH8478> his tongue<WH3956> is mischief<WH5999> and vanity.<WH205>

He sitteth<WH3427> in the lurking places<WH3993> of the villages:<WH2691> in the secret places<WH4565> doth he murder<WH2026> the innocent:<WH5355> his eyes<WH5869> are privily set<WH6845> against the poor.<WH2489>

He lieth in wait<WH693> secretly<WH4565> as a lion<WH738> in his den:<WH5520> he lieth in wait<WH693> to catch<WH2414> the poor:<WH6041> he doth catch<WH2414> the poor,<WH6041> when he draweth<WH4900> him into his net.<WH7568>
He croucheth,<WH1794> and humbleth<WH7817> himself, that the poor<WH2489> may fall<WH5307> by his strong ones.<WH6099>
He hath said<WH559> in his heart,<WH3820> God<WH410> hath forgotten:<WH7911> he hideth<WH5641> his face;<WH6440> he will never<WH1077> <WH5331> see<WH7200> it.
Arise, <WH6965> O LORD;<WH3068> O God,<WH410> lift up<WH5375> thine hand:<WH3027> forget<WH7911> not<WH408> the humble.<WH6035>
Wherefore <WH5921> <WH4100> doth the wicked<WH7563> contemn<WH5006> God?<WH430> he hath said<WH559> in his heart,<WH3820> Thou wilt not<WH3808> require<WH1875> it.

Thou hast seen<WH7200> it; for<WH3588> thou<WH859> beholdest<WH5027> mischief<WH5999> and spite,<WH3708> to requite<WH5414> it with thy hand:<WH3027> the poor<WH2489> committeth<WH5800> himself unto<WH5921> thee; thou<WH859> art<WH1961> the helper<WH5826> of the fatherless.<WH3490>
Break <WH7665> thou the arm<WH2220> of the wicked<WH7563> and the evil<WH7451> man: seek out<WH1875> his wickedness<WH7562> till thou find<WH4672> none.<WH1077>
The LORD<WH3068> is King<WH4428> forever<WH5769> and ever:<WH5703> the heathen<WH1471> are perished<WH6> out of his land.<WH4480> <WH776>
LORD, <WH3068> thou hast heard<WH8085> the desire<WH8378> of the humble:<WH6035> thou wilt prepare<WH3559> their heart,<WH3820> thou wilt cause thine ear<WH241> to hear: <WH7181>
To judge<WH8199> the fatherless<WH3490> and the oppressed,<WH1790> that the man<WH582> of<WH4480> the earth<WH776> may no<WH1077> more<WH3254> <WH5750> oppress.<WH6206>
